intro: Thesium corniculatum, commonly known as the horned thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spire-like inflorescence that resembles a horn, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered along the central axis. Thesium corniculatum is often found in Mediterranean climates and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
